page.title: 03Smarden Land Use 1
page.content: By far the greatest land use in this area is agriculture. It is low lying flat land of heavy Wealden clay, interspersed with many ponds. Arable use is always increasing, barley, wheat, rape & oats in that order are the main crops. Planting is done in the autumn whenever possible. The use of large machines means that unfortunately some hedges have to go to make fields larger and easier to manage. Cider orchards have nearly all gone and hops are on the decline. Hops are no longer picked by hand using local labour, so unless the acreage is large enough for the installation of heavy machinery they do not pay. There are 2 nurseries, several pick-your-own farms with soft fruit and vegetables and a rabbit farm.
